FuncDef:
The syslog threshold statistics-type command configures the log function in a traffic behavior.
The undo syslog threshold statistics-type command cancels the configuration.
By default, the log function is not configured in a traffic behavior.
CLIs: undo syslog threshold <threshold-value> statistics-type { pps | Bps }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a threshold.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Indicates that the packet rate is expressed in pps.
-

Indicates that the packet rate is expressed in bps.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the log function in a traffic behavior, run the syslog threshold statistics-type command. After the log function is configured in a traffic behavior, statistics about the TCP/UDP/IP packet rate in pps or bps are collected. If the packet rate exceeds the threshold, a log is generated. You can enable the device to send the log to the log server for analysis.
This command takes effect only when the destination address is configured to the matching rules in a traffic behavior.
Precautions
Restrictions on syslog for traffic behaviors are as follows:
Syslog check can be implemented only when the statistics function is enabled for the traffic classifier.The traffic policy must be in unshared mode.The traffic classifier profile must be in Or mode, and ACLs have been applied to the traffic classifier profile.
